### CMS

*   [Avo CMS for Rails](https://avohq.io/ruby-on-rails-content-management-system) - Avo is a very custom Content Management System for Ruby on Rails that saves engineers and teams months of development time. *   [Hot Glue (‚≠ê235)](https://github.com/hot-glue-for-rails/hot-glue/) - Hot Glue takes a different approach to building both admin and user dashboards. ### Decorators

### Event Sourcing

*   [Rails Event Store (RES) (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/RailsEventStore/rails_event_store) - A library for publishing, consuming, storing and retrieving events. It's your best companion for going with an event-driven architecture for your Rails application.

### Services and Apps

*   [AppSignal](https://appsignal.com) - Better monitoring for your Rails applications.
*   [Codacy](https://www.codacy.com) - Automated Code Review for Ruby, Rails, JS, PHP, Python etc. Security, Coverage & Quality.

*   [Travis CI](https://travis-ci.com) - Test and Deploy Your Code with Confidence.

### View components

*   [Cells (‚≠ê3.1k)](https://github.com/trailblazer/cells) - View Components for Rails.
*   [Komponent (‚≠ê426)](https://github.com/komposable/komponent) - An opinionated way of organizing front-end code in Rails, based on components.
*   [ViewComponent (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/github/view_component) - View components for Rails.

### View helpers

*   [active\_link\_to (‚≠ê855)](https://github.com/comfy/active_link_to) - View helper to manage "active" state of a link.

### Web Frameworks

*   [Trailblazer (‚≠ê3.5k)](https://github.com/trailblazer/trailblazer) - Trailblazer is a thin layer on top of Rails. It gently enforces encapsulation, an intuitive code structure and gives you an object-oriented architecture.

### WebSocket

*   [AnyCable](http://anycable.io) ‚Äì Polyglot replacement for Ruby WebSocket servers with Action Cable protocol.

### Database Tools

### Scientific

    *   [algorithms (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/kanwei/algorithms) - Library with documentation on when to use a particular structure/algorithm.
    *   [jaro\_winkler (‚≠ê201)](https://github.com/tonytonyjan/jaro_winkler) - Ruby & C implementation of Jaro-Winkler distance algorithm which supports UTF-8 string.
    *   [primes-utils (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/jzakiya/primes-utils) - A Rubygem which provides a suite of extremely fast utility methods for testing and generating primes.
    *   [Roots (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/jzakiya/roots) - A Rubygem which provides utilities to find all the nth roots of real and complex values.
    *   [smarter\_csv (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/tilo/smarter_csv) - Ruby Gem for smarter importing of CSV Files as Array(s) of Hashes.

items.content_text:
### Captchas and anti-spam

*   [Invisible Captcha (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/markets/invisible_captcha) - Unobtrusive and flexible spam protection based on the honeypot strategy. It also provides a time-sensitive form submission.
*   [Rakismet (‚≠ê355)](https://github.com/joshfrench/rakismet) - Easy Akismet and TypePad AntiSpam integration for Rails.
*   [reCAPTCHA (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/ambethia/recaptcha) - reCaptcha API helpers for ruby apps.
*   [Voight-Kampff (‚≠ê190)](https://github.com/biola/Voight-Kampff) - A Ruby gem that detects bots, spiders, crawlers and replicants.

### Concurrency and Parallelism

*   [forkoff (‚≠ê74)](https://github.com/ahoward/forkoff) - brain-dead simple parallel processing for ruby.

### Diff

*   [Diffy (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/samg/diffy) - Easy Diffing With Ruby.
*   [gemdiff (‚≠ê123)](https://github.com/teeparham/gemdiff) - Find source repositories for gems. Open, compare, and update outdated gem versions.
*   [JsonCompare (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/a2design-inc/json-compare) - Returns the difference between two JSON files.

### File Upload

*   [Shrine (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/janko-m/shrine) - Toolkit for handling file uploads in Ruby.

### File System Listener

*   [Guard (‚≠ê6.4k)](https://github.com/guard/guard) - A command line tool to easily handle events on file system modifications.

### HTTP Clients and tools

*   [Device Detector (‚≠ê768)](https://github.com/podigee/device_detector) - A precise and fast user agent parser and device detector, backed by the largest and most up-to-date user agent database.

### IRB

*   [Clipboard (‚≠ê377)](https://github.com/janlelis/clipboard) - Access to the system clipboard on Linux, MacOS and Windows.
*   [Looksee (‚≠ê363)](https://github.com/oggy/looksee) - A tool for illustrating the ancestry and method lookup path of objects. Handy for exploring unfamiliar codebases.

### Machine Learning

*   [Awesome Machine Learning with Ruby (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/arbox/machine-learning-with-ruby) - A Curated List of Ruby Machine Learning Links and Resources.

### Queues and Messaging

*   [Karafka (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/karafka/karafka) - Framework used to simplify Apache Kafka (a distributed streaming platform) based Ruby applications development.

### Web Frameworks

*   [Rack::App (‚≠ê411)](https://github.com/rack-app/rack-app) - Bare bone minimalistic framework for building rack apps.

### Core Extensions

*   [Addressable (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/sporkmonger/addressable) - Addressable is a replacement for the URI implementation that is part of Ruby's standard library. It more closely conforms to RFC 3986, RFC 3987, and RFC 6570 (level 4), providing support for IRIs and URI templates.
*   [Hamster (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/hamstergem/hamster) - Efficient, immutable, and thread-safe collection classes for Ruby.

### Documentation

*   [Hologram (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/trulia/hologram) - A markdown based documentation system for style guides. It parses comments in your CSS and helps you turn them into a beautiful style guide.

items.title: Awesome Ruby Updates on Dec 06, 2014
items.content_text:
### Testing

*   Extra
    *   [Appraisal (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/thoughtbot/appraisal) - Appraisal integrates with bundler and rake to test your library against different versions of dependencies.
    *   [CQL (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/enkessler/cql) - CQL is a library for making queries against Cucumber style test suites.
    *   [cuke\_modeler (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/enkessler/cuke_modeler) - An modeling library for `.feature` files that is an abstration layer on top of the `gherkin` gem, providing a stable base upon which to build other Gherkin related tools.
    *   [gitarro (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/openSUSE/gitarro) - Run, retrigger, handle all type and OS-independent tests against your GitHub Pull Requests.
    *   [Knapsack (‚≠ê527)](https://github.com/ArturT/knapsack) - Optimal test suite parallelisation across CI nodes for RSpec, Cucumber, Minitest, Spinach and Turnip.
    *   [mutant (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/mbj/mutant) - Mutant is a mutation testing tool for Ruby.
    *   [Parallel Tests (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/grosser/parallel_tests) - Speedup Test::Unit + RSpec + Cucumber by running parallel on multiple CPUs (or cores).
    *   [power\_assert (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/k-tsj/power_assert) - Power Assert for Ruby.
    *   [Ruby-JMeter](https://github.com/flood-io/ruby-jmeter) - A Ruby based DSL for building JMeter test plans.
    *   [Spring (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/rails/spring) - Preloads your rails environment in the background for faster testing and Rake tasks.
    *   [timecop (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/travisjeffery/timecop) - Provides "time travel" and "time freezing" capabilities, making it dead simple to test time-dependent code.
    *   [Turbo Tests (‚≠ê192)](https://github.com/serpapi/turbo_tests) - Run RSpec tests on multiple cores. Like `parallel_tests` but with incremental summarized output.
    *   [vcr (‚≠ê5.9k)](https://github.com/vcr/vcr) - Record your test suite's HTTP interactions and replay them during future test runs for fast, deterministic, accurate tests.
    *   [Wraith (‚≠ê4.8k)](https://github.com/BBC-News/wraith) - A responsive screenshot comparison tool.
    *   [Zapata (‚≠ê414)](https://github.com/Nedomas/zapata) - Who has time to write tests? This is a revolutionary tool to make them write themselves.
items.content_html:
Testing

  • Extra
    • Appraisal (‚≠ê1.3k) - Appraisal integrates with bundler and rake to test your library against different versions of dependencies.
    • CQL (‚≠ê26) - CQL is a library for making queries against Cucumber style test suites.
    • cuke_modeler (‚≠ê23) - An modeling library for .feature files that is an abstration layer on top of the gherkin gem, providing a stable base upon which to build other Gherkin related tools.
    • gitarro (‚≠ê15) - Run, retrigger, handle all type and OS-independent tests against your GitHub Pull Requests.

    • Parallel Tests (‚≠ê3.4k) - Speedup Test::Unit + RSpec + Cucumber by running parallel on multiple CPUs (or cores).
    • power_assert (‚≠ê1) - Power Assert for Ruby.
    • Ruby-JMeter - A Ruby based DSL for building JMeter test plans.
    • Spring (‚≠ê2.8k) - Preloads your rails environment in the background for faster testing and Rake tasks.

items.title: Awesome Ruby Updates on Dec 02, 2014
items.content_text:
### Analytics

*   [Impressionist (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/charlotte-ruby/impressionist) - Rails Plugin that tracks impressions and page views.

### API Builder and Discovery

*   [Version Cake (‚≠ê656)](https://github.com/bwillis/versioncake) - An unobtrusive way to version APIs in your Rails app.
*   [versionist (‚≠ê965)](https://github.com/bploetz/versionist) - A plugin for versioning Rails based RESTful APIs.

### Authorization

*   [acl9 (‚≠ê852)](https://github.com/be9/acl9) - Acl9 is a role-based authorization system that provides a concise DSL for securing your Rails application.

### Data Visualization

*   [LazyHighCharts (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/michelson/lazy_high_charts) - A simple and extremely flexible way to use HighCharts from ruby code. Tested on Ruby on Rails, Sinatra and Nanoc, but it should work with others too.

### Database Tools

*   [Seedbank (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/james2m/seedbank) - Seedbank allows you to structure your Rails seed data instead of having it all dumped into one large file.

### Debugging Tools

*   [Xray (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/brentd/xray-rails) - A development tool that reveals your UI's bones.

### Email

*   [premailer-rails (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/fphilipe/premailer-rails) - CSS styled emails without the hassle.
*   [Roadie (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/Mange/roadie) - Roadie tries to make sending HTML emails a little less painful by inlining stylesheets and rewriting relative URLs for you inside your emails.

### Geolocation

*   [geoip (‚≠ê719)](https://github.com/cjheath/geoip) - Searches a GeoIP database for a given host or IP address, and returns information about the country where the IP address is allocated, and the city, ISP and other information.
*   [Google Maps for Rails (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/apneadiving/Google-Maps-for-Rails) - Enables easy Google map + overlays creation in Ruby apps.

### Internationalization

*   [FastGettext (‚≠ê407)](https://github.com/grosser/fast_gettext) - Ruby internationalization tool with less memory, simple, clean namespace and threadsafe.
*   [Globalize (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/globalize/globalize) - Globalize builds on the I18n API in Ruby on Rails to add model translations to ActiveRecord models.

### Security

*   [SecureHeaders (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/twitter/secureheaders) - Automatically apply several headers that are related to security, including: Content Security Policy (CSP), HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), X-Frame-Options (XFO), X-XSS-Protection, X-Content-Type-Options, X-Download-Options & X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies.

### Social Networking

*   [Mailboxer (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/mailboxer/mailboxer) - A private message system for Rails applications.

### Third-party APIs

*   [twilio-ruby (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/twilio/twilio-ruby) - A module for using the Twilio REST API and generating valid TwiML.

items.title: Awesome Ruby Updates on Nov 25, 2014
items.content_text:
### ORM/ODM Extensions

*   Auditing and Versioning
    *   [active\_snapshot (‚≠ê169)](https://github.com/westonganger/active_snapshot) - Simplified snapshots and restoration for ActiveRecord models and associations with a transparent white-box implementation
    *   [acts\_as\_archival (‚≠ê129)](https://github.com/expectedbehavior/acts_as_archival) - ActiveRecord plugin for atomic object tree archiving.
    *   [ActsAsParanoid (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/ActsAsParanoid/acts_as_paranoid) - ActiveRecord plugin allowing you to hide and restore records without actually deleting them.
    *   [Audited (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/collectiveidea/audited) - Audited is an ORM extension for ActiveRecord & MongoMapper that logs all changes to your models.
    *   [Destroyed At (‚≠ê348)](https://github.com/dockyard/ruby-destroyed_at) - Allows you to "destroy" an object without deleting the record or associated records.
    *   [Discard (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/jhawthorn/discard) - A simple ActiveRecord mixin to add conventions for flagging records as discarded.
    *   [Logidze (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/palkan/logidze) - Database changes log for Rails.
    *   [marginalia (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/basecamp/marginalia) - Attach comments to your ActiveRecord queries. By default, it adds the application, controller, and action names as a comment at the end of each query.
    *   [mongoid-history (‚≠ê394)](https://github.com/aq1018/mongoid-history) - Multi-user non-linear history tracking, auditing, undo, redo for mongoid.
    *   [PaperTrail (‚≠ê6.9k)](https://github.com/airblade/paper_trail) - Track changes to your ActiveRecord models' data for auditing or versioning.
    *   [Paranoia (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/radar/paranoia) - A re-implementation of acts\_as\_paranoid for Rails 3 and 4, using much, much, much less code.
    *   [PermenantRecords (‚≠ê272)](https://github.com/JackDanger/permanent_records) - Soft-delete your ActiveRecord records, like an explicit version of ActsAsParanoid.
*   Social
    *   [Merit (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/merit-gem/merit) - Adds reputation behavior to Rails apps in the form of Badges, Points, and Rankings for ActiveRecord or Mongoid.
    *   [PublicActivity (‚≠ê3k)](https://github.com/chaps-io/public_activity) - Provides easy activity tracking for your ActiveRecord, Mongoid 3 and MongoMapper models in Rails 3 and 4. Similar to Github's Public Activity.
    *   [Simple Feed (‚≠ê334)](https://github.com/kigster/simple-feed) - Fast and highly scalable read-optimized social activity feed library in pure Ruby, backed by Redis.
    *   [Unread (‚≠ê742)](https://github.com/ledermann/unread) - Manage read/unread status of ActiveRecord objects - and it's fast.
*   Sorting
    *   [ActsAsList (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/swanandp/acts_as_list) - Provides the capabilities for sorting and reordering a number of objects in a list.
    *   [positioning (‚≠ê321)](https://github.com/brendon/positioning) - Simple positioning for Active Record models. Supports multiple lists per model and relative positioning.
    *   [ranked-model (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/mixonic/ranked-model) - A modern row sorting library for ActiveRecord. It uses ARel aggressively and is better optimized than most other libraries.
*   Tree
    *   [ActsAsTree (‚≠ê590)](https://github.com/amerine/acts_as_tree) - Extends ActiveRecord to add simple support for organizing items into parent‚Äìchildren relationships.
    *   [ActsAsRecursiveTree (‚≠ê83)](https://github.com/1and1/acts_as_recursive_tree) - ActsAsTree but recursive.
    *   [Ancestry (‚≠ê3.8k)](https://github.com/stefankroes/ancestry) - Organise ActiveRecord model into a tree structure using a variation on the materialised path pattern.
    *   [Awesome Nested Set (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/collectiveidea/awesome_nested_set) - Awesome Nested Set is an implementation of the nested set pattern for ActiveRecord models.
    *   [Closure Tree (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/mceachen/closure_tree) - Easily and efficiently make your ActiveRecord models support hierarchies using a Closure Table.
    *   [Mongoid Tree (‚≠ê300)](https://github.com/benedikt/mongoid-tree) - A tree structure for Mongoid documents using the materialized path pattern.

### Search

*   [Mongoid Search (‚≠ê318)](https://github.com/mauriciozaffari/mongoid_search) - Simple full text search implementation for Mongoid.
*   [SearchCop (‚≠ê830)](https://github.com/mrkamel/search_cop) - Extends your ActiveRecord models to support fulltext search engine like queries via simple query strings and hash-based queries.
*   [textacular (‚≠ê953)](https://github.com/textacular/textacular) - Exposes full text search capabilities from PostgreSQL, and allows you to declare full text indexes. Textacular extends ActiveRecord with named\_scope methods making searching easy and fun!

### State Machines

*   [FiniteMachine (‚≠ê806)](https://github.com/peter-murach/finite_machine) - A plain Ruby state machine with a straightforward and expressive syntax.

items.content_text:
### Admin Interface

*   [ActiveAdmin](http://activeadmin.info) - A Ruby on Rails framework for creating elegant backends for website administration.

### Machine Learning

*   [rb-libsvm (‚≠ê278)](https://github.com/febeling/rb-libsvm) - Ruby language bindings for LIBSVM. SVM is a machine learning and classification algorithm.

### Scientific

*   Numerical arrays
    *   [NMatrix (‚≠ê474)](https://github.com/sciruby/nmatrix) - Fast numerical linear algebra library for Ruby.
    *   [Numo::NArray (‚≠ê430)](https://github.com/ruby-numo/numo-narray) - N-dimensional Numerical Array for Ruby.
    *   [mdarray (‚≠ê36)](https://github.com/rbotafogo/mdarray) - Multi dimensional array implemented for JRuby inspired by NumPy.
*   [SciRuby (‚≠ê997)](https://github.com/sciruby/sciruby) - Tools for scientific computation in Ruby/Rails.
    *   [IRuby (‚≠ê917)](https://github.com/SciRuby/iruby) - A Ruby kernel for Jupyter.
    *   [statsample (‚≠ê100)](https://github.com/sciruby/statsample) - A suite for basic and advanced statistics on Ruby.
    *   [statsample-timeseries (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/sciruby/statsample-timeseries) - Bioruby Statsample TimeSeries.
    *   [statsample-glm (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/sciruby/statsample-glm) - Generalized Linear Models extension for Statsample.
    *   [distribution (‚≠ê51)](https://github.com/sciruby/distribution) - Statistical Distributions multi library wrapper.
    *   [minimization (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/sciruby/minimization) - Minimization algorithms on pure Ruby.
*   Specific
    *   [BioRuby (‚≠ê378)](https://github.com/bioruby/bioruby) - Library for developing bioinformatics software.
    *   [bloomfilter-rb (‚≠ê474)](https://github.com/igrigorik/bloomfilter-rb) - BloomFilter(s) in Ruby: Native counting filter + Redis counting/non-counting filters.
    *   [decisiontree (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/igrigorik/decisiontree) - A ruby library which implements ID3 (information gain) algorithm for decision tree learning.

items.title: Awesome Ruby Updates on Oct 24, 2014
items.content_text:
### Admin Interface

*   [bhf](http://antpaw.github.io/bhf/) - A simple to use Rails-Engine-Gem that offers an admin interface for trusted user.
*   [RailsAdmin (‚≠ê7.9k)](https://github.com/sferik/rails_admin) - A Rails engine that provides an easy-to-use interface for managing your data.

### Analytics

*   [Ahoy (‚≠ê4.3k)](https://github.com/ankane/ahoy) - A solid foundation to track visits and events in Ruby, JavaScript, and native apps.
*   [Legato (‚≠ê400)](https://github.com/tpitale/legato) - Model analytics reports and queries against the official Google Analytics Reporting API.
*   [Staccato (‚≠ê390)](https://github.com/tpitale/staccato) - Track analytics into the official Google Analytics Collection API.

### API Builder and Discovery

*   [ActiveModel::Serializers (‚≠ê5.3k)](https://github.com/rails-api/active_model_serializers) - JSON serialization of objects.
*   [jbuilder (‚≠ê4.4k)](https://github.com/rails/jbuilder) - Create JSON structures via a Builder-style DSL.
*   [Pliny (‚≠ê800)](https://github.com/interagent/pliny) - Opinionated template Sinatra app for writing excellent APIs in Ruby.
*   [rabl (‚≠ê3.6k)](https://github.com/nesquena/rabl) - General ruby templating with json, bson, xml, plist and msgpack support.
*   [Roar (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/apotonick/roar) - Resource-Oriented Architectures in Ruby.

### Assets

*   [Sass](http://sass-lang.com) - Sass makes CSS fun again.

### Authentication and OAuth

*   [Authlogic (‚≠ê4.3k)](https://github.com/binarylogic/authlogic) - Authlogic is a clean, simple, and unobtrusive ruby authentication solution.

### Authorization

*   [Pundit (‚≠ê8.4k)](https://github.com/elabs/pundit) - Minimal authorization through OO design and pure Ruby classes.

### Caching

*   [Action caching for Action Pack (‚≠ê265)](https://github.com/rails/actionpack-action_caching) - Action caching for Action Pack.
*   [Dalli (‚≠ê3.1k)](https://github.com/mperham/dalli) - A high performance pure Ruby client for accessing memcached servers.

### CLI Builder

*   [GLI (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/davetron5000/gli) - Git-Like Interface Command Line Parser.
*   [Main (‚≠ê265)](https://github.com/ahoward/main) - A class factory and DSL for generating command line programs real quick.
*   [Slop (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/leejarvis/slop) - Simple Lightweight Option Parsing.
*   [Thor](http://whatisthor.com) - A toolkit for building powerful command-line interfaces.
*   [TTY (‚≠ê2.5k)](https://github.com/peter-murach/tty) - Toolbox for developing CLI clients.

### CMS

*   [Publify (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/publify/publify) - A self hosted Web publishing platform on Rails.
*   [Radiant](http://radiantcms.org) - A no-fluff, open source content management system designed for small teams.

### Code Analysis and Metrics

*   [MetricFu (‚≠ê625)](https://github.com/metricfu/metric_fu) - A fist full of code metrics.
*   [rails\_best\_practices](https://github.com/railsbp/rails_best_practices) - A code metric tool for rails projects.
*   [Reek (‚≠ê4.1k)](https://github.com/troessner/reek) - Code smell detector for Ruby.

### Coding Style Guides

*   [Rails style guide (‚≠ê6.5k)](https://github.com/bbatsov/rails-style-guide) - Community-driven Rails best practices and style for Rails 3 and 4.
*   [RSpec style guide (‚≠ê3.5k)](https://github.com/andreareginato/betterspecs) - Better Specs { rspec guidelines with ruby }.
*   [Ruby style guide (‚≠ê17k)](https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide) - Community-driven Ruby coding style.

### Concurrency and Parallelism

*   [EventMachine (‚≠ê4.3k)](https://github.com/eventmachine/eventmachine) - An event-driven I/O and lightweight concurrency library for Ruby.

### Configuration

*   [Configatron (‚≠ê596)](https://github.com/markbates/configatron) - Simple and feature rich configuration system for Ruby apps.
*   [Configus (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/kaize/configus) - Helps you easily manage environment specific settings.
*   [dotenv (‚≠ê6.7k)](https://github.com/bkeepers/dotenv) - Loads environment variables from `.env`.
*   [Econfig (‚≠ê66)](https://github.com/elabs/econfig) - Flexible configuration for Rails applications.
*   [Figaro (‚≠ê3.8k)](https://github.com/laserlemon/figaro) - Simple, Heroku-friendly Rails app configuration using `ENV` and a single YAML file.
*   [Global (‚≠ê284)](https://github.com/railsware/global) - Provides accessor methods for your configuration data.

### Core Extensions

*   Hash
    *   [Hashie (‚≠ê3k)](https://github.com/intridea/hashie) - A collection of tools that extend Hashes and make them more useful.

### Country Data

*   [Carmen (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/jim/carmen) - A repository of geographic regions.
*   [Countries (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/hexorx/countries) - All sorts of useful information about every country packaged as pretty little country objects.
*   [i18n\_data (‚≠ê224)](https://github.com/grosser/i18n_data) - country/language names and 2-letter-code pairs, in 85 languages, for country/language i18n.
*   [normalize\_country (‚≠ê69)](https://github.com/sshaw/normalize_country) - Convert country names and codes to a standard, includes a conversion program for XMLs, CSVs and DBs.

### Database Drivers

*   [Cassandra Driver (‚≠ê236)](https://github.com/datastax/ruby-driver) - A pure ruby driver for Apache Cassandra with asynchronous io and configurable load balancing, reconnection and retry policies.
*   [mongo-ruby-driver (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/mongodb/mongo-ruby-driver) - MongoDB Ruby driver.
*   [mysql2 (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/brianmario/mysql2) - A modern, simple and very fast Mysql library for Ruby (binding to libmysql).
*   [Redic (‚≠ê120)](https://github.com/amakawa/redic) - Lightweight Redis Client.
*   [redis-rb (‚≠ê4k)](https://github.com/redis/redis-rb) - A Ruby client that tries to match Redis' API one-to-one, while still providing an idiomatic interface.

### Database Tools

*   [PgHero (‚≠ê8.5k)](https://github.com/ankane/pghero) - Postgres insights made easy.

### Date and Time Processing

*   [business\_time (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/bokmann/business_time) - Support for doing time math in business hours and days.
*   [Chronic (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/mojombo/chronic) - A natural language date/time parser written in pure Ruby.
*   [groupdate (‚≠ê3.9k)](https://github.com/ankane/groupdate) - The simplest way to group temporal data in ActiveRecord, arrays and hashes.
*   [time\_diff (‚≠ê146)](https://github.com/abhidsm/time_diff) - Calculates the difference between two time.
*   [TZinfo (‚≠ê369)](https://github.com/tzinfo/tzinfo) - Provides daylight savings aware transformations between times in different timezones.
*   [validates\_timeliness (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/adzap/validates_timeliness) - Date and time validation plugin for ActiveModel and Rails.
*   [yymmdd (‚≠ê77)](https://github.com/sshaw/yymmdd) - Tiny DSL for idiomatic date parsing and formatting.

### Decorators

*   [Draper (‚≠ê5.3k)](https://github.com/drapergem/draper) - Draper adds an object-oriented layer of presentation logic to your Rails application.

### DevOps Tools

*   [Capistrano](http://capistranorb.com) - A remote server automation and deployment tool written in Ruby.
*   [Puppet (‚≠ê7.6k)](https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet) - An automated administrative engine for your Linux, Unix, and Windows systems, performs administrative tasks (such as adding users, installing packages, and updating server configurations) based on a centralized specification.
*   [Vagrant](http://www.vagrantup.com) - Create and configure lightweight, reproducible, and portable development environments.

### Documentation

*   [Inch (‚≠ê520)](https://github.com/rrrene/inch) - Inch is a documentation measurement and evalutation tool for Ruby code, based on YARD.
*   [YARD](http://yardoc.org) - YARD enables the user to generate consistent, usable documentation that can be exported to a number of formats very easily.

### E-Commerce and Payments

*   [Paypal Merchant SDK](https://github.com/paypal/merchant-sdk-ruby) - Official Paypal Merchant SDK for Ruby.
*   [ROR Ecommerce (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/drhenner/ror_ecommerce) - A Rails e-commerce platform.
*   [Spree (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/spree/spree) - Spree is a complete open source e-commerce solution for Ruby on Rails.
*   [stripe-ruby (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/stripe/stripe-ruby) - Stripe Ruby bindings.

### Ebook

*   [Gepub (‚≠ê244)](https://github.com/skoji/gepub) - A generic EPUB library for Ruby : supports EPUB 3.
*   [Mobi (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/jkongie/mobi) - A Ruby way to read MOBI format metadata.
*   [Review (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/kmuto/review) - Re:VIEW is flexible document format/conversion system.

### Email

*   [Incoming (‚≠ê307)](https://github.com/honeybadger-io/incoming) - Incoming! helps you receive email in your Rack apps.
*   [Mail (‚≠ê3.6k)](https://github.com/mikel/mail) - A Really Ruby Mail Library.
*   [Pony (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/benprew/pony) - The express way to send mail from Ruby.

### Environment Management

*   [chruby (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/postmodern/chruby) - Change your current Ruby. No shims, no crazy options or features, \~90 LOC.
*   [fry (‚≠ê63)](https://github.com/terlar/fry) - Simple ruby version manager for fish.
*   [gem\_home (‚≠ê118)](https://github.com/postmodern/gem_home) - A tool for changing your $GEM\_HOME.
*   [rbenv (‚≠ê16k)](https://github.com/sstephenson/rbenv) - Use rbenv to pick a Ruby version for your application and guarantee that your development environment matches production.
*   [ruby-build (‚≠ê3.9k)](https://github.com/sstephenson/ruby-build) - Compile and install Ruby.
*   [ruby-install (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/postmodern/ruby-install) - Installs Ruby, JRuby, Rubinius, MagLev or MRuby.
*   [RVM](https://rvm.io) - RVM is a command-line tool which allows you to easily install, manage, and work with multiple ruby environments from interpreters to sets of gems.

### Error Handling

*   [Airbrake (‚≠ê975)](https://github.com/airbrake/airbrake) - The official Airbrake library for Ruby on Rails (and other Rack based frameworks).
*   [Better Errors (‚≠ê6.9k)](https://github.com/charliesome/better_errors) - Better error page for Rack apps.
*   [Exception Notification (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/smartinez87/exception_notification) - A set of notifiers for sending notifications when errors occur in a Rack/Rails application.
*   [Nesty (‚≠ê118)](https://github.com/skorks/nesty) - Nested exceptions for Ruby.

### File Upload

Admin Interface

  • bhf - A simple to use Rails-Engine-Gem that offers an admin interface for trusted user.

  • Staccato (‚≠ê390) - Track analytics into the official Google Analytics Collection API.

API Builder and Discovery

  • jbuilder (‚≠ê4.4k) - Create JSON structures via a Builder-style DSL.
  • Pliny (‚≠ê800) - Opinionated template Sinatra app for writing excellent APIs in Ruby.
  • rabl (‚≠ê3.6k) - General ruby templating with json, bson, xml, plist and msgpack support.
  • Roar (‚≠ê1.8k) - Resource-Oriented Architectures in Ruby.

Assets

  • Sass - Sass makes CSS fun again.

Authentication and OAuth

  • Authlogic (‚≠ê4.3k) - Authlogic is a clean, simple, and unobtrusive ruby authentication solution.

Authorization

  • Pundit (‚≠ê8.4k) - Minimal authorization through OO design and pure Ruby classes.

Caching

  • Action caching for Action Pack (‚≠ê265) - Action caching for Action Pack.
  • Dalli (‚≠ê3.1k) - A high performance pure Ruby client for accessing memcached servers.

CLI Builder

  • GLI (‚≠ê1.3k) - Git-Like Interface Command Line Parser.

CMS

Code Analysis and Metrics

  • Reek (‚≠ê4.1k) - Code smell detector for Ruby.

Coding Style Guides

Documentation

  • Inch (‚≠ê520) - Inch is a documentation measurement and evalutation tool for Ruby code, based on YARD.
  • YARD - YARD enables the user to generate consistent, usable documentation that can be exported to a number of formats very easily.

E-Commerce and Payments

  • Paypal Merchant SDK - Official Paypal Merchant SDK for Ruby.
  • ROR Ecommerce (‚≠ê1.2k) - A Rails e-commerce platform.
  • Spree (‚≠ê15k) - Spree is a complete open source e-commerce solution for Ruby on Rails.
  • stripe-ruby (‚≠ê2k) - Stripe Ruby bindings.

Ebook

  • Gepub (‚≠ê244) - A generic EPUB library for Ruby : supports EPUB 3.
  • Mobi (‚≠ê38) - A Ruby way to read MOBI format metadata.
  • Review (‚≠ê1.4k) - Re:VIEW is flexible document format/conversion system.

Email

  • Incoming (‚≠ê307) - Incoming! helps you receive email in your Rack apps.
  • Mail (‚≠ê3.6k) - A Really Ruby Mail Library.
  • Pony (‚≠ê1.1k) - The express way to send mail from Ruby.

Environment Management

  • chruby (‚≠ê2.9k) - Change your current Ruby. No shims, no crazy options or features, ~90 LOC.
  • fry (‚≠ê63) - Simple ruby version manager for fish.
  • gem_home (‚≠ê118) - A tool for changing your $GEM_HOME.
  • rbenv (‚≠ê16k) - Use rbenv to pick a Ruby version for your application and guarantee that your development environment matches production.
  • ruby-build (‚≠ê3.9k) - Compile and install Ruby.
  • ruby-install (‚≠ê1.9k) - Installs Ruby, JRuby, Rubinius, MagLev or MRuby.
  • RVM - RVM is a command-line tool which allows you to easily install, manage, and work with multiple ruby environments from interpreters to sets of gems.

Error Handling

  • Airbrake (‚≠ê975) - The official Airbrake library for Ruby on Rails (and other Rack based frameworks).
  • Better Errors (‚≠ê6.9k) - Better error page for Rack apps.
  • Exception Notification (‚≠ê2.2k) - A set of notifiers for sending notifications when errors occur in a Rack/Rails application.
  • Nesty (‚≠ê118) - Nested exceptions for Ruby.

File Upload

  • CarrierWave (‚≠ê8.8k) - Classier solution for file uploads for Rails, Sinatra and other Ruby web frameworks.
  • DragonFly (‚≠ê2.1k) - A Ruby gem for on-the-fly processing - suitable for image uploading in Rails, Sinatra and much more!.
  • rack-secure-upload (‚≠ê74) - Upload files securely.

Form Builder

  • Formtastic (‚≠ê5.2k) - A Rails form builder plugin with semantically rich and accessible markup.
  • Rails Bootstrap Forms (‚≠ê1.6k) - Rails form builder that makes it super easy to create beautiful-looking forms with Twitter Bootstrap 3+.

Game Development and Graphics

  • Gosu - A 2D game development library for the Ruby and C++ programming languages.

Geolocation

  • Geocoder (‚≠ê6.4k) - A complete geocoding solution for Ruby. With Rails it adds geocoding (by street or IP address), reverse geocoding (find street address based on given coordinates), and distance queries.
  • Geokit (‚≠ê1.6k) - Geokit gem provides geocoding and distance/heading calculations.

Git Tools

  • git-auto-bisect (‚≠ê87) - Find the commit that broke master.
  • git-spelunk (‚≠ê47) - Dig through git blame history.
  • git-whence (‚≠ê21) - Find which merge a commit came from.
  • Rugged (‚≠ê2.3k) - Ruby bindings to libgit2.

GUI

  • qtbindings (‚≠ê338) - Allows the QT Gui toolkit to be used from Ruby.
  • Shoes - Shoes makes building little graphical programs for Mac, Windows, and Linux super simple.

HTML/XML Parsing

  • HappyMapper (‚≠ê151) - Object to XML mapping library, using Nokogiri.

HTTP Clients and tools

  • Faraday (‚≠ê5.8k) - an HTTP client lib that provides a common interface over many adapters (such as Net::HTTP) and embraces the concept of Rack middleware when processing the request/response cycle.
  • Http Client (‚≠ê706) - Gives something like the functionality of libwww-perl (LWP) in Ruby.
  • httparty (‚≠ê5.9k) - Makes http fun again!
  • RESTClient (‚≠ê5.2k) - Simple HTTP and REST client for Ruby, inspired by microframework syntax for specifying actions.
  • Sawyer (‚≠ê247) - Secret user agent of HTTP, built on top of Faraday.
  • Typhoeus (‚≠ê4.1k) - Typhoeus wraps libcurl in order to make fast and reliable requests.

Image Processing

  • MiniMagick (‚≠ê2.9k) - A ruby wrapper for ImageMagick or GraphicsMagick command line.
  • PSD.rb (‚≠ê3.1k) - Parse Photoshop files in Ruby with ease.
  • RMagick (‚≠ê715) - RMagick is an interface between Ruby and ImageMagick.

Internationalization

  • i18n-tasks (‚≠ê2.1k) - Manage missing and unused translations with the awesome power of static analysis.
  • i18n (‚≠ê1k) - Ruby Internationalization and localization solution.
  • twitter-cldr-rb (‚≠ê685) - Ruby implementation of the ICU (International Components for Unicode) that uses the Common Locale Data Repository to format dates, plurals, and more.

Logging

  • Fluentd (‚≠ê13k) - Fluentd collects events from various data sources and writes them to files, database or other types of storages.
  • Log4r (‚≠ê250) - Log4r is a comprehensive and flexible logging library for use in Ruby programs.
  • Scrolls (‚≠ê158) - Simple logging.
  • Yell (‚≠ê0) - Your Extensible Logging Library.

Machine Learning

  • PredictionIO Ruby SDK (‚≠ê190) - The PredictionIO Ruby SDK provides a convenient API to quickly record your users' behavior and retrieve personalized predictions for them.

Markdown Processors

  • kramdown (‚≠ê1.7k) - Kramdown is yet-another-markdown-parser but fast, pure Ruby, using a strict syntax definition and supporting several common extensions.
  • Maruku (‚≠ê504) - A pure-Ruby Markdown-superset interpreter.
  • Redcarpet (‚≠ê5k) - A fast, safe and extensible Markdown to (X)HTML parser.

Money

  • eu_central_bank (‚≠ê217) - A gem that calculates the exchange rate using published rates from European Central Bank.
  • Money (‚≠ê2.8k) - A Ruby Library for dealing with money and currency conversion.

Natural Language Processing

  • Treat (‚≠ê1.4k) - Treat is a toolkit for natural language processing and computational linguistics in Ruby.

ORM/ODM

  • Sequel (‚≠ê5k) - Sequel is a simple, flexible, and powerful SQL database access toolkit for Ruby.

Pagination

  • Kaminari (‚≠ê27) - A Scope & Engine based, clean, powerful, customizable and sophisticated paginator for modern web app frameworks and ORMs.
  • will_paginate (‚≠ê5.7k) - A pagination library that integrates with Ruby on Rails, Sinatra, Merb, DataMapper and Sequel.

PDF

  • Pdfkit (‚≠ê2.9k) - HTML+CSS to PDF using wkhtmltopdf.
  • Prawn (‚≠ê4.7k) - Fast, Nimble PDF Writer for Ruby.
  • Wicked Pdf (‚≠ê3.6k) - PDF generator (from HTML) plugin for Ruby on Rails.

Performance Monitoring

  • New Relic (‚≠ê1.2k) - Find and fix Ruby errors with New Relic application monitoring and troubleshooting.

Process Management and Monitoring

  • Bluepill (‚≠ê417) - Simple process monitoring tool.
  • God (‚≠ê2.2k) - An easy to configure, easy to extend monitoring framework written in Ruby.

Processes

  • posix-spawn (‚≠ê524) - Fast Process::spawn for Rubys >= 1.8.7 based on the posix_spawn() system interfaces.

Profiler and Optimization

  • bullet (‚≠ê7.2k) - Help to kill N+1 queries and unused eager loading.
  • Peek (‚≠ê3.2k) - Visual status bar showing Rails performance.
  • rack-mini-profiler (‚≠ê3.8k) - Profiler for your development and production Ruby rack apps.
  • ruby-prof (‚≠ê2k) - A code profiler for MRI rubies.

Queues and Messaging

  • Delayed::Job (‚≠ê4.8k) - Database backed asynchronous priority queue.
  • Resque (‚≠ê9.5k) - A Redis-backed Ruby library for creating background jobs.

Scheduling

  • resque-scheduler (‚≠ê1.7k) - A light-weight job scheduling system built on top of Resque.
  • rufus-scheduler (‚≠ê2.4k) - Job scheduler for Ruby (at, cron, in and every jobs).
  • Whenever (‚≠ê8.9k) - A Ruby gem that provides a clear syntax for writing and deploying cron jobs.

Search

  • pg_search (‚≠ê1.5k) - Builds ActiveRecord named scopes that take advantage of PostgreSQL's full text search.
  • Rroonga (‚≠ê66) - The Ruby bindings of Groonga.
  • Sunspot (‚≠ê3k) - A Ruby library for expressive, powerful interaction with the Solr search engine.
  • Thinking Sphinx (‚≠ê1.6k) - A library for connecting ActiveRecord to the Sphinx full-text search tool.

SEO

  • FriendlyId (‚≠ê6.2k) - The "Swiss Army bulldozer" of slugging and permalink plugins for Active Record.
  • MetaTags (‚≠ê2.8k) - A gem to make your Rails application SEO-friendly.
  • SitemapGenerator (‚≠ê2.5k) - A framework-agnostic XML Sitemap generator written in Ruby.

Social Networking

  • diaspora* (‚≠ê14k) - A privacy aware, distributed, open source social network.
  • Discourse (‚≠ê45k) - A platform for community discussion. Free, open, simple.
  • Social Shares (‚≠ê327) - A gem to check how many times url was shared in social networks.

State Machines

  • AASM (‚≠ê5.1k) - State machines for Ruby classes (plain Ruby, Rails Active Record, Mongoid).
  • simple_states (‚≠ê96) - A super-slim statemachine-like support library.
  • Statesman (‚≠ê1.8k) - A statesmanlike state machine library.
  • Workflow (‚≠ê1.8k) - A finite-state-machine-inspired API for modeling and interacting with what we tend to refer to as 'workflow'.

Static Site Generation

  • High Voltage (‚≠ê3.2k) - Easily include static pages in your Rails app.
  • Middleman - A static site generator using all the shortcuts and tools in modern web development.
  • Nanoc - A static site generator, fit for building anything from a small personal blog to a large corporate web site.

Template Engine

  • Curly (‚≠ê591) - A template language that completely separates structure and logic.
  • Haml (‚≠ê3.8k) - HTML Abstraction Markup Language.
  • Liquid (‚≠ê11k) - Safe, customer facing template language for flexible web apps.
  • Mustache (‚≠ê3.1k) - Logic-less Ruby templates.
  • Slim (‚≠ê5.3k) - A template language whose goal is reduce the syntax to the essential parts without becoming cryptic.
  • Tilt (‚≠ê1.9k) - Generic interface to multiple Ruby template engines.

Testing

  • Frameworks
    • RSpec (‚≠ê62) - Behaviour Driven Development for Ruby.
      • Formatters
        • Emoji-RSpec (‚≠ê173) - Custom Emoji Formatters for RSpec.
        • Fuubar (‚≠ê961) - The instafailing RSpec progress bar formatter.
        • Nyan Cat (‚≠ê738) - Nyan Cat inspired RSpec formatter!
    • Aruba (‚≠ê955) - Testing command line applications with cucumber and rspec.
    • Bacon (‚≠ê428) - A small RSpec clone.
    • Capybara (‚≠ê10k) - Acceptance test framework for web applications.
    • Cucumber (‚≠ê3.4k) - BDD that talks to domain experts first and code second.
    • Cutest (‚≠ê153) - Isolated tests in Ruby.
    • Fix (‚≠ê48) - Specing framework for Ruby.
    • Howitzer (‚≠ê260) - Ruby based framework for acceptance testing
    • minitest (‚≠ê3.3k) - minitest provides a complete suite of testing facilities supporting TDD, BDD, mocking, and benchmarking.
    • Mocha (‚≠ê1.3k) - Mocha is a mocking and stubbing library for Ruby.
    • RR (‚≠ê324) - A test double framework that features a rich selection of double techniques and a terse syntax.
    • shoulda-matchers (‚≠ê3.6k) - Provides Test::Unit- and RSpec-compatible one-liners that test common Rails functionality. These tests would otherwise be much longer, more complex, and error-prone.
    • Spinach (‚≠ê577) - Spinach is a high-level BDD framework that leverages the expressive Gherkin language (used by Cucumber) to help you define executable specifications of your application or library's acceptance criteria.
    • TestBench (‚≠ê73) - TestBench is a principled test framework for Ruby and MRuby aiming to offer precisely what is needed to test well-designed code effectively and easily.
    • Test::Unit - Test::Unit is a xUnit family unit testing framework for Ruby.
  • Mock
    • ActiveMocker (‚≠ê504) - Generate mocks from ActiveRecord models for unit tests that run fast because they don‚Äôt need to load Rails or a database.
    • DnsMock (‚≠ê65) - Ruby DNS mock. Mimic any DNS records for your test environment and even more.
    • DuckRails (‚≠ê1.7k) - Tool for mocking API endpoints quickly & dynamically.
    • SmtpMock (‚≠ê65) - Ruby SMTP mock. Mimic any SMTP server behaviour for your test environment with fake SMTP server.
    • TestXml (‚≠ê30) - TestXml is a small extension for testing XML/HTML.
    • WebMock (‚≠ê4k) - Library for stubbing and setting expectations on HTTP requests.
  • WebDrivers
    • Ferrum (‚≠ê1.9k) - High-level API to control Chrome in Ruby.
    • Poltergeist (‚≠ê2.5k) - A PhantomJS driver for Capybara.
    • Selenium WebDriver (‚≠ê33k) - Ruby bindings for WebDriver.
    • Watir (‚≠ê1.5k) - Web application testing in Ruby.

Third-party APIs

  • flickr (‚≠ê20) - A Ruby interface to the Flickr API.
  • gitlab (‚≠ê1.1k) - Ruby wrapper and CLI for the GitLab API.
  • hipchat-rb (‚≠ê335) - HipChat HTTP API Wrapper in Ruby with Capistrano hooks.
  • instagram-ruby-gem (‚≠ê1.4k) - The official gem for the Instagram REST and Search APIs.
  • itunes_store_transporter (‚≠ê120) - Ruby wrapper around Apple's iTMSTransporter program.
  • linkedin (‚≠ê759) - Provides an easy-to-use wrapper for LinkedIn's REST APIs.
  • Octokit - Ruby toolkit for the GitHub API.
  • ruby-gmail (‚≠ê791) - A Rubyesque interface to Gmail.
  • ruby-trello (‚≠ê718) - Implementation of the Trello API for Ruby.
  • soundcloud-ruby (‚≠ê7) - Official SoundCloud API Wrapper for Ruby.
  • t (‚≠ê5.4k) - A command-line power tool for Twitter.
  • tweetstream (‚≠ê1.1k) - A simple library for consuming Twitter's Streaming API.
  • twitter (‚≠ê4.6k) - A Ruby interface to the Twitter API.
  • Yt (‚≠ê750) - An object-oriented Ruby client for YouTube API V3.

Web Crawling

  • MetaInspector (‚≠ê1k) - Ruby gem for web scraping purposes.
  • Upton (‚≠ê1.6k) - A batteries-included framework for easy web-scraping.
  • Wombat (‚≠ê1.3k) - Web scraper with an elegant DSL that parses structured data from web pages.

Web Frameworks

  • Cuba - A microframework for web development.
  • Padrino - A full-stack ruby framework built upon Sinatra.
  • Roda - A routing tree web framework.
  • Ruby on Rails - A web-application framework that includes everything needed to create database-backed web applications according to the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern.
  • Sinatra - Classy web-development dressed in a DSL.

Web Servers

  • Phusion Passenger - Fast and robust web server and application server.
  • Puma (‚≠ê7.8k) - A modern, concurrent web server for Ruby.
  • Rack - A common Ruby web server interface. By itself, it's just a specification and utility library, but all Ruby web servers implement this interface.
  • Unicorn - Rack HTTP server for fast clients and Unix.

WebSocket

  • Faye - A set of tools for simple publish-subscribe messaging between web clients.

items.title: Awesome Ruby Updates on Aug 26, 2014
items.content_text:
### Assets

*   [Less Rails (‚≠ê339)](https://github.com/metaskills/less-rails) - The dynamic stylesheet language for the Rails asset pipeline.

### Code Analysis and Metrics

*   [Brakeman (‚≠ê7.1k)](https://github.com/presidentbeef/brakeman) - A static analysis security vulnerability scanner for Ruby on Rails applications.
*   [Flay (‚≠ê749)](https://github.com/seattlerb/flay) - Flay analyzes code for structural similarities. Differences in literal values, variable, class, method names, whitespace, programming style, braces vs do/end, etc are all ignored. Making this totally rad.
*   [Flog (‚≠ê947)](https://github.com/seattlerb/flog) - Flog reports the most tortured code in an easy to read pain report. The higher the score, the more pain the code is in.
*   [Rubycritic (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/whitesmith/rubycritic) - A Ruby code quality reporter.
*   [SimpleCov (‚≠ê4.8k)](https://github.com/colszowka/simplecov) - Code coverage for Ruby 1.9+ with a powerful configuration library and automatic merging of coverage across test suites.

### Core Extensions

*   [ActiveSupport (‚≠ê57k)](https://github.com/rails/rails/tree/master/activesupport) - A collection of utility classes and standard library extensions.
*   [Ruby Facets (‚≠ê801)](https://github.com/rubyworks/facets) - The premiere collection of general purpose method extensions and standard additions for Ruby.

### Dashboards

*   [Dashing-Rails (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/gottfrois/dashing-rails) - The exceptionally handsome dashboard framework for Rails.

### Data Visualization

*   [RailRoady (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/preston/railroady) - Ruby on Rails 3/4 model and controller UML class diagram generator.
*   [Rails Erd (‚≠ê4.1k)](https://github.com/voormedia/rails-erd) - Generate Entity-Relationship Diagrams for Rails applications.

### Database Tools

*   [Database Cleaner (‚≠ê3k)](https://github.com/DatabaseCleaner/database_cleaner) - Database Cleaner is a set of strategies for cleaning your database in Ruby.

### Debugging Tools

*   [Byebug (‚≠ê3.3k)](https://github.com/deivid-rodriguez/byebug) - A simple to use, feature rich debugger for Ruby 2.

### DevOps Tools

*   [Lita](https://www.lita.io/) - ChatOps for Ruby: A pluggable chat bot framework usable with any chat service.
*   [Mina (‚≠ê4.4k)](https://github.com/mina-deploy/mina) - Really fast deployer and server automation tool.
*   [Rubber (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/rubber/rubber) - The rubber plugin enables relatively complex multi-instance deployments of RubyOnRails applications to Amazon's Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2).

### Email

*   [LetterOpener (‚≠ê3.8k)](https://github.com/ryanb/letter_opener) - Preview mail in the browser instead of sending.

### HTML/XML Parsing

*   [ROXML (‚≠ê223)](https://github.com/Empact/roxml) - Custom mapping and bidirectional marshalling between Ruby and XML using annotation-style class methods, via Nokogiri or LibXML.

### HTTP Clients and tools

*   [excon (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/excon/excon) - Usable, fast, simple Ruby HTTP 1.1. It works great as a general HTTP(s) client and is particularly well suited to usage in API clients.
*   [Patron (‚≠ê544)](https://github.com/toland/patron) - Patron is a Ruby HTTP client library based on libcurl.
*   [Savon (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/savonrb/savon) - Savon is a SOAP client for the Ruby programming language.

### Internationalization

*   [r18n (‚≠ê515)](https://github.com/ai/r18n) - Advanced i18n library for Rails, Sinatra, desktop apps, models, works well with complex languages like Russian.

### Logging

*   [HttpLog (‚≠ê813)](https://github.com/trusche/httplog) - Log outgoing HTTP requests.
*   [Logging (‚≠ê532)](https://github.com/TwP/logging) - A flexible logging library for use in Ruby programs based on the design of Java's log4j library.
*   [Lograge (‚≠ê3.5k)](https://github.com/roidrage/lograge) - An attempt to tame Rails' default policy to log everything.

### PDF

*   [Kitabu (‚≠ê680)](https://github.com/fnando/kitabu) - A framework for creating e-books from Markdown/Textile text markup using Ruby.
*   [RGhost (‚≠ê188)](https://github.com/shairontoledo/rghost) - RGhost is a document creation and conversion API.

### Processes

*   [childprocess (‚≠ê580)](https://github.com/jarib/childprocess) - Cross-platform ruby library for managing child processes.

### Robotics

*   [Artoo](http://artoo.io) - Next generation robotics framework with support for different platforms: Arduino, Leap Motion, Pebble, Raspberry Pi, etc.

### RSS

*   [Feed normalizer (‚≠ê134)](https://github.com/aasmith/feed-normalizer) - Extensible Ruby wrapper for Atom and RSS parsers.
*   [Feedjira (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/feedjira/feedjira) - A feed fetching and parsing library.
*   [Simple rss (‚≠ê225)](https://github.com/cardmagic/simple-rss) - A simple, flexible, extensible, and liberal RSS and Atom reader.

### Search

*   [ransack (‚≠ê5.8k)](https://github.com/activerecord-hackery/ransack/) - Object-based searching.
*   [Searchkick (‚≠ê6.6k)](https://github.com/ankane/searchkick) - Searchkick learns what your users are looking for. As more people search, it gets smarter and the results get better. It‚Äôs friendly for developers - and magical for your users.

### Testing

*   Fake Data
    *   [Fabrication](http://fabricationgem.org/) - A simple and powerful object generation library.
    *   [factory\_bot (‚≠ê8.1k)](https://github.com/thoughtbot/factory_bot) - A library for setting up Ruby objects as test data.
    *   [Fake Person (‚≠ê117)](https://github.com/adamcooke/fake-person) - Uses some of the most popular given & surnames in the US & UK.
    *   [faker (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/stympy/faker) - A library for generating fake data such as names, addresses, and phone numbers.
    *   [ffaker (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/ffaker/ffaker) - A faster Faker, generates dummy data, rewrite of faker.
    *   [Forgery (‚≠ê788)](https://github.com/sevenwire/forgery) - Easy and customizable generation of forged data.

### Third-party APIs

*   [wikipedia (‚≠ê307)](https://github.com/kenpratt/wikipedia-client) - Ruby client for the Wikipedia API.

### Web Crawling

*   [LinkThumbnailer (‚≠ê512)](https://github.com/gottfrois/link_thumbnailer) - Ruby gem that generates thumbnail images and videos from a given URL. Much like popular social website with link preview.
*   [Mechanize (‚≠ê4.4k)](https://github.com/sparklemotion/mechanize) - Mechanize is a ruby library that makes automated web interaction easy.
items.content_html:
Assets

  • Less Rails (‚≠ê339) - The dynamic stylesheet language for the Rails asset pipeline.

Code Analysis and Metrics

  • Brakeman (‚≠ê7.1k) - A static analysis security vulnerability scanner for Ruby on Rails applications.
  • Flay (‚≠ê749) - Flay analyzes code for structural similarities. Differences in literal values, variable, class, method names, whitespace, programming style, braces vs do/end, etc are all ignored. Making this totally rad.
  • Flog (‚≠ê947) - Flog reports the most tortured code in an easy to read pain report. The higher the score, the more pain the code is in.
  • Rubycritic (‚≠ê3.4k) - A Ruby code quality reporter.
  • SimpleCov (‚≠ê4.8k) - Code coverage for Ruby 1.9+ with a powerful configuration library and automatic merging of coverage across test suites.

Core Extensions

  • ActiveSupport (‚≠ê57k) - A collection of utility classes and standard library extensions.
  • Ruby Facets (‚≠ê801) - The premiere collection of general purpose method extensions and standard additions for Ruby.

Dashboards

  • Dashing-Rails (‚≠ê1.4k) - The exceptionally handsome dashboard framework for Rails.

Data Visualization

  • RailRoady (‚≠ê1.7k) - Ruby on Rails 3/4 model and controller UML class diagram generator.
  • Rails Erd (‚≠ê4.1k) - Generate Entity-Relationship Diagrams for Rails applications.

Database Tools

  • Database Cleaner (‚≠ê3k) - Database Cleaner is a set of strategies for cleaning your database in Ruby.

Debugging Tools

  • Byebug (‚≠ê3.3k) - A simple to use, feature rich debugger for Ruby 2.

DevOps Tools

  • Lita - ChatOps for Ruby: A pluggable chat bot framework usable with any chat service.
  • Mina (‚≠ê4.4k) - Really fast deployer and server automation tool.
  • Rubber (‚≠ê1.5k) - The rubber plugin enables relatively complex multi-instance deployments of RubyOnRails applications to Amazon's Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2).

Email

  • LetterOpener (‚≠ê3.8k) - Preview mail in the browser instead of sending.

HTML/XML Parsing

  • ROXML (‚≠ê223) - Custom mapping and bidirectional marshalling between Ruby and XML using annotation-style class methods, via Nokogiri or LibXML.

HTTP Clients and tools

  • excon (‚≠ê1.2k) - Usable, fast, simple Ruby HTTP 1.1. It works great as a general HTTP(s) client and is particularly well suited to usage in API clients.
  • Patron (‚≠ê544) - Patron is a Ruby HTTP client library based on libcurl.
  • Savon (‚≠ê2.1k) - Savon is a SOAP client for the Ruby programming language.

Internationalization

  • r18n (‚≠ê515) - Advanced i18n library for Rails, Sinatra, desktop apps, models, works well with complex languages like Russian.

Logging

  • HttpLog (‚≠ê813) - Log outgoing HTTP requests.
  • Logging (‚≠ê532) - A flexible logging library for use in Ruby programs based on the design of Java's log4j library.
  • Lograge (‚≠ê3.5k) - An attempt to tame Rails' default policy to log everything.

PDF

  • Kitabu (‚≠ê680) - A framework for creating e-books from Markdown/Textile text markup using Ruby.
  • RGhost (‚≠ê188) - RGhost is a document creation and conversion API.

Processes

  • childprocess (‚≠ê580) - Cross-platform ruby library for managing child processes.

Robotics

  • Artoo - Next generation robotics framework with support for different platforms: Arduino, Leap Motion, Pebble, Raspberry Pi, etc.

RSS

  • Feed normalizer (‚≠ê134) - Extensible Ruby wrapper for Atom and RSS parsers.
  • Feedjira (‚≠ê2.1k) - A feed fetching and parsing library.
  • Simple rss (‚≠ê225) - A simple, flexible, extensible, and liberal RSS and Atom reader.

Search

  • ransack (‚≠ê5.8k) - Object-based searching.
  • Searchkick (‚≠ê6.6k) - Searchkick learns what your users are looking for. As more people search, it gets smarter and the results get better. It‚Äôs friendly for developers - and magical for your users.

Testing

  • Fake Data
    • Fabrication - A simple and powerful object generation library.
    • factory_bot (‚≠ê8.1k) - A library for setting up Ruby objects as test data.
    • Fake Person (‚≠ê117) - Uses some of the most popular given & surnames in the US & UK.
    • faker (‚≠ê11k) - A library for generating fake data such as names, addresses, and phone numbers.
    • ffaker (‚≠ê1.6k) - A faster Faker, generates dummy data, rewrite of faker.
    • Forgery (‚≠ê788) - Easy and customizable generation of forged data.

Third-party APIs

  • wikipedia (‚≠ê307) - Ruby client for the Wikipedia API.

Web Crawling

  • LinkThumbnailer (‚≠ê512) - Ruby gem that generates thumbnail images and videos from a given URL. Much like popular social website with link preview.
  • Mechanize (‚≠ê4.4k) - Mechanize is a ruby library that makes automated web interaction easy.
